duties_responsibilities.duty: Attend cases within a territory and assist clinicians in the development of THV procedural skills.
Provide guidance on the use of the device, enabling physicians and staff to reach expert proficiency and deliver positive patient outcomes.
Collaborate with multiple departments including Sales, Clinical Affairs, Marketing, Quality, Regulatory, and Education.
Plan and implement growth strategies within focused accounts in partnership with Sales Management.
Develop clinical champions among current and potential customers for the advocacy of THV products.
Utilize acquired knowledge to educate physicians and staff to reach expert proficiency in the THV procedure to deliver positive patient outcomes.
Partner with Territory Managers to develop the proper selection criteria for sites.
Plan and implement physician and support staff trainings.
Assist in the development of the THV procedure in both Cardiology and Surgery.
Support cases outside of assigned region, on an as needed basis.

education_certification.credential: An associate’s or equivalent two (2) year clinical degree in Life Sciences or related field or equivalent work experience is required. A minimum of three (3) years of experience working in the sterile environment of a cath lab or operating room required.
